principles.name: Professional Circle Exposure as Learning Catalyst
principles.description: 'The exposure of working with various attorneys in thirty different states... you just get to know them, and you go out to dinner and things like that. You just learn a lot, not about law and taxes, but in everything. You learn from them.' This broad professional exposure creates knowledge beyond core competencies.

principles.name: Judgment Over Technical Skills Application
principles.description: At the Limited, 'being a CPA wasn't that important... It was more about just taking that. I was making a lot of their judgments on appeals and litigation and everything. So it was more about judgment than anything versus advising a client.'

principles.name: Big Company Perspective as Small Business Advantage
principles.description: 'I can bring them a big company and big CPA firm perspective that they otherwise don't get.' The combination of large organization experience applied to small business contexts creates unique value.

principles.name: Responsibility Progression Through Specialization
principles.description: Career progression from 'super specialist' at big CPA firm where 'I was a step removed from helping them' to Limited where 'I'm still a specialist, but I have greater responsibility.'

patterns.name: Cross-Professional Learning Integration
patterns.description: Actively absorb knowledge from diverse professional contacts beyond core technical areas, using social interactions to build broader perspective.
patterns.context: Professional roles involving extensive interaction with experts from other fields, where relationship-building creates learning opportunities.

patterns.name: Large Organization Experience Translation
patterns.description: Apply big company systems, perspectives, and judgment frameworks to small business contexts where such sophistication is typically unavailable.
patterns.context: Consulting or advisory work with smaller organizations that lack access to enterprise-level thinking and processes.

examples.name: Attorney Network Learning Experience
examples.content: At the Limited, Dan gained 'exposure of working with various attorneys in thirty different states' and learning from them during dinners and social interactions. He notes 'you just learn a lot, not about law and taxes, but in everything' and that 'most attorneys are huge history buffs' who know their local history extensively.

examples.name: Big Company Perspective Advantage
examples.content: Dan's career progression from large CPA firm specialist to Limited corporate role to local CPA firm allows him to 'bring them a big company and big CPA firm perspective that they otherwise don't get' when working with small businesses.
